review_preview: A restaurant well deserving it's reputation and surprisingly affordable for its Michellin status. End of the day the chef Diego Guerroro focus appears to be about the food. The message a silent revolution printed on potatoe paper served with a peanut/pepper mousse starts the degustation...
review_full: A restaurant well deserving it's reputation and surprisingly affordable for its Michellin status. End of the day the chef Diego Guerroro focus appears to be about the food. The message a silent revolution printed on potatoe paper served with a peanut/pepper mousse starts the degustation adventure. Our waitress Zulema Matas and Sommelier Javiar Barroso enhanced the 3 hour sensory experience. Reviews prior to this have gone through the various dishes. To repeat, each were an experience in itself. At 250 for 2 people with 3 glasses of wine each and a 12 course degustation over 3 hours, I would consider it value for money. Obviously not an everyday event, but for a special meal or event. Made our anniversary.

title_review: Grown up prices - but your kids would love it!
review_preview: Made lunch reservations (dinner was full for ages) at the last minute our first day in Madrid.  I don't know if the menus is any cheaper (70EU pp for a pri fixe menu), but we were the only people there for the first our of...
review_full: Made lunch reservations (dinner was full for ages) at the last minute our first day in Madrid. I don't know if the menus is any cheaper (70EU pp for a pri fixe menu), but we were the only people there for the first our of our meal and it was a privilege. The service was amazing - even though we speak no Spanish - the staff tried so hard to answer our questions and explain each dish. The chef himself - Diego Guererro - came to our table twice to check on us. Truly he came across as a tortured artist - a slave to his creations. He really took pleasure in our enjoyment of the meal. We later saw the press releases and realized he's quite the celebrity and could have been arrogant as he wanted he's famous for his creations. And they are creations! This is the first meal I recall taking a photo of every course served just because I felt words alone could not describe what we were eating. If I could go back and take my kids (Tweens & teens who will eat anything - there's obviously not a kids' menu here), I would and just starve the rest of the trip with no money left for food. His creations are pure magic. Every dish was like cirque de soleil with us asking "how did they do that?!"

review_preview: My husband and I dined at El Club Allard for his birthday dinner.  We went with the traditional menu.  The servers were attentive without being intrusive.  The initial atmosphere was a bit formal but as the night went on--the focus was on the food!  Every...
review_full: My husband and I dined at El Club Allard for his birthday dinner. We went with the traditional menu. The servers were attentive without being intrusive. The initial atmosphere was a bit formal but as the night went on--the focus was on the food! Every dish was beautifully presented, some were whimsical, others were works of art! We enjoyed the majority of the dishes. The taste and portions were more than adequate for us. The highlights were the foie dish and the fishbowl dessert. They even brought out a beautifully decorated sign "Happy Birthday" for my husband. Overall, a very very special night. Truly memorable!  You need to book well in advance! But is is worth the effort.

title_review: Small bar big welcome and great food
review_preview: This is a narrow bar that spills into a small (20ish seating) restaurant at the back. There is a warm greeting from the bar staff who speak a range of languages. We waited 25mins or so for a table and we are glad we did....
review_full: This is a narrow bar that spills into a small (20ish seating) restaurant at the back. There is a warm greeting from the bar staff who speak a range of languages. We waited 25mins or so for a table and we are glad we did. We asked what we should have and were served some great dishes. Our party of four enjoyed the shredded beef in Cuban sauce, garlic gambas, mousaka, potatas bravas... we were told we could add any more if we needed but were told to save room for the home made cakes... chocolate cake, cheese cake, carrott cake, we are glad we did. With a bottle of wine, 4 proseccos we were very happy to pay 80 euros. Noisy but warm and inviting atmosphere.

review_full: The problem about a Sunday is that half the shops do not open. Another we faced was the Copa del ray final, meaning most 'open' establishments had no hot food until 930pm. Fortunately we stumbled past el Sur around 7.30, followed by another pack of hungry Germans, asked about the kitchen and the deal was done.  Potent sangria with plenty of fruit, followed by half of the 'house specials' on the menu. Typical starving over order. Still delicious enough that we we're resigned to waddling home. Around 830 and the place was jam packed, so I'd recommend going earlier.

review_full: Last restaurant I had booked in Madrid. So very, very good! Everything was a joy from the service, the wines and the food. Special mention to the Bresse Pigeon which, when matched with a Tempranillo was the best pigeon dish I ever had! The staff were out of this world and attentive and knowledgeable. The sommelier took me on a great tour of Spanish wine, but also displayed a knowledge of Australian wine to give me something that I could compare to. Once again, the staff graciously forgave my lack of Spanish and helped me out immensely. Please note that you should be appropriately dressed for this restaurant with a suit jacket or quality shirt. Highly Recommended.

review_preview: This is a truly secret address you would want to share with somebody really special. Set in a beautiful building with the door to the restaurant hidden inside on the ground floor. Once inside, this restaurant has a small dining room with white table cloths...
review_full: This is a truly secret address you would want to share with somebody really special. Set in a beautiful building with the door to the restaurant hidden inside on the ground floor. Once inside, this restaurant has a small dining room with white table cloths black medallion chairs, brass chandeliers and black and white photographs all of which exude quiet and relaxed elegance. The menu comes in short, medium and long, and you can inform (when you book ahead) if you have any special food allergies. No formal dress code is required but a casual elegant outfit would be best suitable to the atmosphere and the usual clientele. As for food, few michelin chefs can do well in both main courses and also dessert. Chef Diego on the other hand exceeds all expectations. In a very light-hearted Spanish style, every dish is humbly presented with a cheeky humor and so much creative thinking that makes you smile at your food. The trouble Chef Diego goes through to get the right touch and the right taste is just impeccable.  Also do bring a camera, you will regret not to. The very pretty desserts are absolutely eye popping.

title_review: Great food, but waiters need to relax.
review_preview: A nice Michelin starred restaurant, we have visited several across the world, so for us it is fun to compare. Food was great, 10 course menu with really good flavors. Smoked eel, "sea popcorn", quail egg cupcake, "sea rice", grilled duck, Red mullet, Wagyu beef,...
review_full: A nice Michelin starred restaurant, we have visited several across the world, so for us it is fun to compare. Food was great, 10 course menu with really good flavors. Smoked eel, "sea popcorn", quail egg cupcake, "sea rice", grilled duck, Red mullet, Wagyu beef, Hibiscus flower, chocolate cluster and to end with a plate with passionfruite, chocolate truffle and marmalade.  Waiters/dinningroom straff need to relax a bit and give more time for the guests to be able to look at the wine list for a example. We only got to the point of opening the wine list before we already were recommended a bottle of wine, and then the menus were removed, so please give the guests more time to look at the menus. Otherwise the staff was helpful and kind, felt just a bit stressed. A positive thing was that the chef came to check in the end of the dinner if we liked the food. So only thing to think about is, perhaps it it better to open a bit earlier so guests gets some more time to read the menus?

review_preview: Visited with my spouse for lunch. Had a 12 course with matching wines. The food was great. Especially the smoked eel, grilled duck and the wagyu. The last maybe the best beef I ever had. The 12 courses was enough, could probably not have eaten...
review_full: Visited with my spouse for lunch. Had a 12 course with matching wines. The food was great. Especially the smoked eel, grilled duck and the wagyu. The last maybe the best beef I ever had. The 12 courses was enough, could probably not have eaten much more.  We asked the sommelier for paired wines. Got 5 glasses: One Cava, two whites, one red and one dessert wine. All good. None exceptional.  The staff was attentive and friendly. The place is a bit stiff though. Wear a shirt/blazer. The experience with food, wine and coffee endes up just below €300. Which i feel was reasonable. I still must admit that I was expecting a bit more, but not enough to give anything less than 5 stars. Highly recommend the place. 9/10.

review_preview: We took our oldest child (16) for his first real taste of Spanish Michelin star cooking.  What an introduction!  The meal here was truly excellent.  Beware though that the restaurant entrance is not easy to find, so travel with an address and expect a low...
review_full: We took our oldest child (16) for his first real taste of Spanish Michelin star cooking. What an introduction! The meal here was truly excellent. Beware though that the restaurant entrance is not easy to find, so travel with an address and expect a low key entrance. The staff were excellent and the food was of the Basque "food as illusion" type. the piece de resistance was a dessert which appeared to be a fresh laid egg on straw, but was chocolate and blancmange and mango. The chef said that once he had the idea, it took two months of proofing to get it right. This is the creativity and excellence you are paying for. Wonderful.

review_full: We loved the whole thing. Don't ask questions. Find space in your budget and go. One of us has some food allergies that can get in the way of going with tasting menus and cause us to avoid tasting-menu-only places. We made an exception here, with some trepidation. No need to have worried. They ask about allergies on the website when you book. (They also get back to you promptly when you send in your reservation request.) We came in ready for a negotiation about the menu. No need. They said, don't worry it will be taken care of, and it was. When you show up, there's no sign of a restaurant at the indicated address. Don't worry, just go in. It's all part of the show.

review_preview: When I dine at a Michelin star rated restaurant I have certain expectations. When we arrived we were ushered to a private table of 5 by a staff of multiple attentive employees.  The lack of ambiance was surprising - bright room, antique feel, no warmth...
review_full: When I dine at a Michelin star rated restaurant I have certain expectations. When we arrived we were ushered to a private table of 5 by a staff of multiple attentive employees. The lack of ambiance was surprising - bright room, antique feel, no warmth or background music to set the mood.  Our staff was plentiful however in my opinion, couldn't have been more unprofessional. They seemed to be hovering too much without knowing how and when to be helpful. We had to ask a couple of times to refill water (even though they were there) and when we were making a private family toast one of the waiters literally interrupted us to ask a question!  Since this is a tasting menu we wanted to order wine that complimented our dishes. Aside from the waiters, the wine "expert" was not able to guide us. Most of us speak English and surprisingly none of the waiters could answer our questions. We were hoping to at least find out if there was meat being served so that we could order a red wine. Instead we were pointed to a white during meat courses. Our expectation in a fine restaurant in a major city is that the staff has a good grasp of the English language.  The food was absolutely delicious as one would expect from a highly priced tasting menu. It was beautifully presented , creative and very fresh. We ordered the 10 course meal and the number of starters ,main dishes and desserts were just right. Again one would expect the food to be paced out nicely, but the first few courses were being served too quickly one after the other. We had to ask them to slow down the pace. And lastly especially since the staff was plentiful it would have been appropriate for each course to be placed at the same time in front of the diner. It was staggered and brought two at a time.  Given the amazing restaurants at this level in Madrid I'm sure there are other establishments with equally amazing food but with a more professional and knowledgable staff. One chooses this type of a place for the experience and I feel it fell short.

review_preview: El Club Allard excels in its classy ambience and classy exterior and interior design, and in itself, the food is thoughtful, modern and fine. But if you had read the prior reviews and praises on Tripadvisor, you would have come with high expectations. El Club...
review_full: El Club Allard excels in its classy ambience and classy exterior and interior design, and in itself, the food is thoughtful, modern and fine. But if you had read the prior reviews and praises on Tripadvisor, you would have come with high expectations. El Club Allard met ours, and therefore is worthy of commendation, but it did not wow us with a truly two-star Michelin experience (as Dstage did but with its one star). Food - innovative and artistically presented There is no doubt much thought had been painstakingly poured into the design of the courses (we went for the 12), but the dishes looked so effortlessly chic each of them could have been an art piece. Interestingly the presentation outperformed the taste (presentation 8.5, taste around 8). Wine - good, but sommelier dispensed with the banter Service - decent, seems like it is not in the nature of El Club Allard to make much small talk to its customers. And hence the business lunch vibe. Verdict - come but go to Dstage first. Or no, if you have time, come to El Club Allard first for a nice meal and then be transported into space by Dstage.

title_review: Spectacular Fusion of Asian and Local Cuisine
review_preview: Visited this place for the first time two weeks ago and was blown away. All the food was amazing but I would give pride of place to the Tartar de Langostino Tigre (Tiger Prawn tartar with Cod skin) which I think were the most deliciously...
review_full: Visited this place for the first time two weeks ago and was blown away. All the food was amazing but I would give pride of place to the Tartar de Langostino Tigre (Tiger Prawn tartar with Cod skin) which I think were the most deliciously prepared prawns I have ever had the pleasure of eating. The Gyozas de Rabo de Toro (ox tail gyozas - really!) were fantastic too. The place itself is nice and the staff friendly and professional. Madrileños wouldn't consider this location off the beaten path but it's a little outside the main tourist areas around Sol, Plaza Mayor and the Gran Vía. It'd be a 15-20 minute walk from Gran Vía or take the Metro to Bilbao - if you like your food and are looking for something different and innovative it will be well worth the effort!

review_full: If you want to eat tapas like a local, the it’s imperative that you try Casa Toni. I was sent to Madrid on a TDY (that’s temporary duty). I had no choice but to eat out every night for 30 days. After trying all of the tourists trap places I discovered where the locals eat. Their glasses of vino run around 2.50 (euros) and most tapas are 4.00 to 9.00.  They cook their stuff right behind the bar and it comes out hot and delicious. Their service is friendly and genuine. All in all, this place is outstanding.  Thank you

title_review: This is not just dining, this is way more than that
review_preview: Whoever walks in Miyama with the idea of having just a bit of sushi it won't get disappointed but it will miss a unique chance to enjoy one of the best meals of his/her life. This restaurant doesn't have a great view, it's not a...
review_full: Whoever walks in Miyama with the idea of having just a bit of sushi it won't get disappointed but it will miss a unique chance to enjoy one of the best meals of his/her life. This restaurant doesn't have a great view, it's not a cool place to see and be seen....this is a cathedral where you walk in and you expect to get blessed with a never ending unique session of the finest favor and best food display that you will probably get in all Madrid. The attention to the details and the special mix of japanese traditional and spanish ingredients and taste make Miyama a must. The chief manager is not only a great guy with lots of interesting stories, he is also a sake sommelier and if you are sake lover don't miss the opportunity to taste some of the finest bottle available in Europe. A multi course dinner at Miyama is a cultural experience that I recommend you to enjoy with someone who is able to appreciate it, otherwise is like going to El Prado and have your guest walk in front of Tiziano without even notice it!

title_review: Japanese sushi: the search for excellent quality!
review_preview: After a thorough search for finding the best quality sushi in Madrid I booked a table for 2 in Miyama,  influenced by all the reviews I read from fellow Trip Advisor critics some of them raving about the place. My take is a bit more...
review_full: After a thorough search for finding the best quality sushi in Madrid I booked a table for 2 in Miyama, influenced by all the reviews I read from fellow Trip Advisor critics some of them raving about the place. My take is a bit more moderate after trying it out: I did find the quality of the material to be excellent , but I was let down by the "diner style " booths and the excessive light in the restaurant for dinner time. Perhaps my idea of "dinner" is linked to a more atmospheric ambience which I did not find. Perhaps it may be a restaurant to try for lunch rather than dinner?  The service was excellent and some of the presentations of the dishes as well. I attach a photo of the California rolls which I found impressive, although my personal preference calls for a different sprinkle (they had red caviar) because this one had a rather strong taste.

review_preview: I don’t really understand how this place has such positive reviews. Did I visit on a bad night??? I’m super annoyed right now about how much time we wasted at this place. First, we waited outside of the hotel in a line. Then, we were...
review_full: I don’t really understand how this place has such positive reviews. Did I visit on a bad night??? I’m super annoyed right now about how much time we wasted at this place. First, we waited outside of the hotel in a line. Then, we were finally brought upstairs to another line. After they finally sat us, the host says that we can get a table outside in 15-20 mins....ok cool. We’re sitting there for at least 15 mins, and notice that not only has no one come to take our drink order, but literally one table out of all the tables there had actual drinks. We waited probably 20 mins for a person to come and ask what we want to drink. Mind you, there is no music or anything at this establishment, so you’re all just sitting there. After the guy takes our drink order, it took at least another 10 mins to get the two drinks. While waiting, and while sipping our drinks, various people were being called to go and sit outside - including people who had just say and people who had gotten there long after we did. We finally had to ask the guy why we were being sat outside and he just kind of laughed it off. About 10 mins later we get sat outside. Not a single person came to ask how we were doing on drinks or for us to able to order another. We finished our first drinks and left. Total waste of time. There are so many bars in the area. Go to one of those instead.

review_preview: came in after a long stroll at Chueca neighborhood. read all the reviews and hoped for the best. the waiting at the cool trendy designed lobby of the room-mate Oscar seemed promising...Well, after about 15 mins wait at the lobby some came and invied...
review_full: came in after a long stroll at Chueca neighborhood. read all the reviews and hoped for the best. the waiting at the cool trendy designed lobby of the room-mate Oscar seemed promising... Well, after about 15 mins wait at the lobby some came and invied us with another couple to the elevator. we go in just to find that he went to talk to someone in the lobby living us in a small elevator to wait (you need a card to go up so we had to wait for him). after few minutes the guy from reception saw us there so he rushed, apologized and swiped his card to set us free. we arrived to the top floor, wondered through the hotel corridor (remind me not to be a gust in this hotel staying on the top floor with constant traffic out the corridor) and arrived to the bar. it was a bit cold outside so we preferred to sit inside.  we truly hoped to be able to sit outside and enjoy the view, but for some reason there is no cover outside, and if you don't love being cold you have to sit ON the heater or you will have to sit inside the "couches" (cubic white things) were not very comfortable. the cocktail list was short, based on some classics with no innovation, nothing inspiring, nothing like trendy innovative cocktail bars with professional barmen. And then we realized - there was no music. nothing. have you ever visited a cocktail bar, a roof-top bar without background music? for me it was the first time ever and it was so weird. eventually we finished our boring drinks, paid our bill and left after about 30 mins. the views are nice, nothing exceptional. Don't understand the ranking, don't understand the reviews, so many better places all over Madrid.

title_review: Wow wow wow! An absolute must!!
review_preview: Ok so I have to admit that this place was 5th on my list that I’d favourited on this latest visit to Madrid.Salamanca isn’t an area I’ve stayed in before.So there I was, looking for somewhere which served dinner before 9pm as I...
review_full: Ok so I have to admit that this place was 5th on my list that I’d favourited on this latest visit to Madrid. Salamanca isn’t an area I’ve stayed in before. So there I was, looking for somewhere which served dinner before 9pm as I was knackered and just wanted an early night. The first 4 were not serving.... I rang up whilst standing in a street corner about a 10 min walk away to check that they were open and could host a table for one.  Of course they could! I eaves dropped on other tables to get the gist of what people were ordering and coupled that with a recommendation from the waiter.... Tempura prawns and grilled Octopus. Well! I was in heaven. Not only was this THE best prawn I’ve ever had in my life (and my husband will tell you I will totally come back as a prawn, given the amount I’ve eaten in my life, all over the world.....) but THE best octopus I’ve ever had in my life.... I’m here for another night and my rule has always been never to dine twice for fear of losing out on another place but I’m seriously tempted. 10/10...fabulous....

title_review: Great alternative to eating at the NH hotel!
review_preview: I was staying at the NH hotel which is just around the corner from this little gem. I was trying to decide what to do for supper and thought this place might be an interesting alternative to being lazy and eating in the hotel. I...
review_full: I was staying at the NH hotel which is just around the corner from this little gem. I was trying to decide what to do for supper and thought this place might be an interesting alternative to being lazy and eating in the hotel. I was so glad I made the effort. Its a small place but by Spanish standards I was early and sat down as the only diner at 19.00. The staff were very friendly, helpful and found me a menu written in English. They also quickly found me a large glass of house Rijoca which I very much enjoyed while I scanned the menu. I ended up trying to order loads of different tapas and my waiter respectfully suggested I ordered half of the things I was considering and then made a call based on whether I had room to eat any more! Great advice. I tried loads of things I've never eaten before and some that I have. I'm a real sucker for croquettes and there were three variations on offer. The chefs special was good but the one with chunks of Iberico ham were my favourite. Nice friendly atmosphere, helpful and attentive staff and great food. I will certainly swing by again the next time I'm in town.

review_preview: Went here on a Monday night and ordered the patatas bravas, seafood paella, shredded Cuban beef and wok vegetables with rice. Traveling as a couple plus parents we were looking for a local hidden gem that would cater to everybody's needs and we found it...
review_full: Went here on a Monday night and ordered the patatas bravas, seafood paella, shredded Cuban beef and wok vegetables with rice. Traveling as a couple plus parents we were looking for a local hidden gem that would cater to everybody's needs and we found it with Taberna el Sur. The food was great, with the patatas bravas (they should sell the sauce bottled up - sooooo good) and the paella being the best. The service was amazing, we were seated after waiting just a couple of minutes at the bar while the servers cleared a table and received our drinks and food rather quickly. Our servers Peter and Gus kept the conversations flowing in between serving us and made it a fun experience communicating with our limited Spanish and were helpful in English when we got stuck.  The location is in a small alley, it's a cozy setting with just a few tables and mostly visited by locals - not over crowded as some of the more touristy spots around Plaza Mayor. Prices were good and portions were large. Highly recommended!

title_review: Very good food, good quantity, good service
review_preview: The title summarizes that.  It's my second time in Sagar and I repeated because I was very satisfied after my first visit.  In both cases it was a success with my guests, in both cases knowledgeable of Indian cuisine.  While many dishes are the usual...
review_full: The title summarizes that. It's my second time in Sagar and I repeated because I was very satisfied after my first visit. In both cases it was a success with my guests, in both cases knowledgeable of Indian cuisine. While many dishes are the usual suspects (chicken tikka massala, lamb vindaloo, etc) they have others that are not so widespread or well-known. As the waiter for an off-the-beaten-track recommendation. We had a gosht do piayazi (lamb dupiaza) which was superb. The spinach with cheese was also very good and super-tasty. The cheese naan, just cooked, was a treat with the melted cheese in our mouths. At the end we were given some liquors for free and one lady with us was given an ankle bracelet as unexpected present. The waiters speak English if that is important for you. Definitely a must. Only drawback is that parking in that zone is very difficult, so unless you go on off-peak hours or plan to go to a parking (there are parking lots very close by) or just take public transportation.

La comida no es cara pero tampoco barata, esperen pagar 20€ por persona fuera del menú diario.

Same tasting food is just a sign that the chef is probably just using the same base sauce. Service; was very good. Drinks were always topped up or we were asked if we wanted anything else. They also gave us a couple of freebies which always goes down well.

title_review: Sunday Brunch - Bad food, terrible service with nice views
review_preview: I went yesterday for brunch at the rooftop, we sat and were told to wait 10min for the food which was self service buffet. After 20min the food arrived, there was some average sushi (3 kinds of maki) which one had to serve with a...
review_full: I went yesterday for brunch at the rooftop, we sat and were told to wait 10min for the food which was self service buffet. After 20min the food arrived, there was some average sushi (3 kinds of maki) which one had to serve with a fork due to the absence of any proper cutlery, soya sauce wouldn't be available till 30min later, there was also a pitcher with a tasty gazpacho but no cups to pour it. Some tomato and mozzarella sticks, good jamon, and a mayo and pasta salad. No bread or butter, eggs, marmelade, assorted cheese or anything resembling as a brunch menu. The staff seemed a bit lost without any idea of what and when would be served, after I asked if that was all the food available in brunch buffet if there was any bread at all and if they started to serve brunches today they told me that bread would come as well as a variety of warm dishes and desserts and that beforehand they had a good catering company providing the food and since 2 or 3 days they were being catered by the restaurant downstairs - Paris Tokyo. We noticed they were complaining to get more food from downstairs and 15min later they brought some chicken teriyaki and rice, was not bad, and some basic Spanish croquetas, that was it, the desserts were mere fruit sticks. With 2 drinks,included this would be 25eur each for what is sold as a brunch and it seems more like give the customers some whatever food while they pay for the views.. So between the bad food, clueless service and the dirty pool, the views didn't seem that impressive anymore. I used to find the concept of the room mate hotels quite nice, now i can pretty much say that they will never see me as a customer again and the same for the presumptuous restaurant downstairs.. In chueca within 5min walk there are many nice meal options for less than 15eur 2 courses and dessert..

review_preview: I had been to this place nearly thrice in a week now and intend to go there another 3 or 4 times during the last week of my stay here. The place is run well and you have to make reservations during the weekends. I...
review_full: I had been to this place nearly thrice in a week now and intend to go there another 3 or 4 times during the last week of my stay here. The place is run well and you have to make reservations during the weekends. I liked everything that I had so far at this place. The best starter is the Paneer Till Sizzler. The Paneer is neither too soft nor too hard. If you are not a big fan of the paneer then you can try the Pakora which is very good. The chutneys go with both of these dishes. The Biriyani was the first main course that I had here which was very nice and very filling too. We can have it done very spicy or medium hot. I guess the latter was better. The Naans and the Rotis will always have butter on them, so if you want to avoid butter please tell them. The Raita at this place was the best as they let you choose the vegetables that goes in them :) The Vegetable kofta was obviously the best side dish at this place. Their speciality was the Malai kofta, but I was not a big fan of it because they had coconut in it which tasted a little odd. The service is very unique and personal here than at the other restaurants which is a big plus.

title_review: The best rooftop bar in Madrid!
review_preview: I went to the rooftop bar at the hotel during my stay in Madrid for a few nights, a friend of mine highly recommended it and it definitely didn't disappoint! The rooftop bar is located on the 7th floor. It overlooks most of Madrid and...
review_full: I went to the rooftop bar at the hotel during my stay in Madrid for a few nights, a friend of mine highly recommended it and it definitely didn't disappoint! The rooftop bar is located on the 7th floor. It overlooks most of Madrid and the views from it are breathtaking, not to mention the cocktails! The staff were friendly and couldn't do enough for you! Especially our bartender, Max, who created many of the cocktails on the menu and even went to the trouble of explaining us their origins and the people, places and moments that inspired him to create them! It was a whole experience drinking his creations alone! I'm disappointed we didn't choose this hotel to stay in but will definitely be booking in next time I go to Madrid! This bar is perfect for couples and has a very relaxed atmosphere. Definitely a place you MUST go to when visiting Madrid!

title_review: Intimate and delicious; a good place to enjoy tapas
review_preview: Taberna Degusta (metro: Diego de Leon) is a nice, intimate, tapa hang out in Barrio Salamanca. Bring a few friends or even just yourself to sit back and have a drink and a good chat over some delicious tapa style dishes. The menu is nice...
review_full: Taberna Degusta (metro: Diego de Leon) is a nice, intimate, tapa hang out in Barrio Salamanca.  Bring a few friends or even just yourself to sit back and have a drink and a good chat over some delicious tapa style dishes.  The menu is nice over dishes for a range of budgets. But a nice tinto de verano and one of the several mini tortillas will only set you back about 5-6 euros. A nice preliminary tapa (mine was smoked salmon on French bread pieces) started us off.  I tried two of the tortillas, a 1/2 ration of huevos rotos de corral con trufa, and for dessert, the brownie casero.  Everything is displayed nicely and brought out piping hot.  There is also a flat screen displaying tantalizing photos of all the dishes offered in the restaurant. (A very nice touch)  I enjoyed and will be returning.

We paid 30€ for vodka and sparkling water, (there seemingly wasn't any soda which we asked for as sparkling water was given),and a G&T which had a single slice of cucumber in it, I would just expect better for the money and a venue of such high caliber.  The views were no more impressive than those from the terrace of our hotel (Emperador), in fact I would say the latter are better. In terms of atmosphere we were hoping for something to kick start our Saturday night however we found it to be soulless, no music or ambiance. It's a shame as we had read so many positive reviews but personally we would not return.

title_review: Plan To Have a Drink on your Vist to Madrid
review_preview: La Terraza Oscar is the Rooftop pool and bar area for the hotel Room Mate Oscar in the Chueca District of Madrid.  This entire area is vibrant with so many great restaurants and bars its difficult to choose from.  I stayed at Room Mate Oscar...
review_full: La Terraza Oscar is the Rooftop pool and bar area for the hotel Room Mate Oscar in the Chueca District of Madrid. This entire area is vibrant with so many great restaurants and bars its difficult to choose from. I stayed at Room Mate Oscar so visited La Terraza Oscar a few times over four days. During the day its pool focused and at night it turns into a beautiful nightclub atmosphere where you can have a drink and watch the sun set. It is in demand! On weekends there were lines outside and the hotel has to limit access simply due to occupancy limits its just that nice. Hotel Guests have priority access to the rooftop which is very nice. Drinks were great and served with either olives or something sweet. I did not really have an appetizer there so hard to rate food but most come for the great view, great atmosphere and great sunset.

title_review: Great rooftop, stupendous cocktails and  a glorious sunset
review_preview: Greetings again, Our Madrid escapade needs a special discovery to make going back to Spain's capital all the more pressing! And this particular venue fits the bill quite well :)There isn't going to be much to say about the food, since we didn't eat...
review_full: Greetings again, Our Madrid escapade needs a special discovery to make going back to Spain's capital all the more pressing! And this particular venue fits the bill quite well :) There isn't going to be much to say about the food, since we didn't eat there, only drank a substantial amour of funny liquids in all sorts of strange and wondrous glasses. A few words about the setting first. Getting in might be a hassle since they have a limited amount of tables, so the best bet, and now I know as well is to book a table. The terrace is situated on the last floor of a trendy hotel in Madrid's thriving gay quarter (so all of you who are offended by that, stay clear... all the better for the rest of us who enjoy a good view and great drinks, but enough said on that). Not that it matters, or that anything suspicious is going on up there. It's a open space with a pool in the middle, a bar, great, views over the center of the old city. Only the terrace of the cercle of arts has a better view (because it's 360). Oscar's "only" 3/4 of the view, the bar is the way. And one could argue that fact since the terrace is not a rectangle. But I digress. The view is just great, we had the sun going down on north, the city turning to the nightlife mode on the south and we where decking it out on the pool. (it as empty for repairs though) music was playing the back ground, and the temperature was just about right for sipping a cold delicious cocktail. So what about those cocktails. Well tried the flame en co' which I misread. imagine a bloody mary where you change mary by maria y flamethrower y conception OLE! It's like a everything great spain has to offer thrown at you by a ranging bull. Some of you won't like it. I started by hating it. then after 3 sips, you sort of finally get it. then it hits you, layer after layer of flavours and all that complexity tells you: yes , this is the cocktail for connaisseurs, this is the one which finally gets you to understand the way of the shaker. The other thing was some sort of mad layered thing with mango in it which everybody seemed to enjoy. a lot sweeter than expected though.  In all with craft cocktail in hand, pool filled and a good DJ this particular rooftop bar is one of the best in madrid!

title_review: Tasty vegan food in a very relaxed atmosphere
review_preview: We came here for lunch after a long morning of art-viewing in the Prado. The appetizers, including the mixed croquettes and the vegetable ceviche, were very good. Entrees were a bit more hit-or-miss: my vegetable burger was forgettable but the risotto and tacos were good....
review_full: We came here for lunch after a long morning of art-viewing in the Prado. The appetizers, including the mixed croquettes and the vegetable ceviche, were very good. Entrees were a bit more hit-or-miss: my vegetable burger was forgettable but the risotto and tacos were good. Desserts (crumble and cheesecake) were so-so. The atmosphere is very low-key and the service very friendly and happy, but don't come here if you're in a hurry. Our meal took 2 hours, which was long even for 3 courses.

review_preview: Having traveled for over two weeks in France and Spain by the time we reached Madrid we were ready for a good Indian meal.My wife being a strict vegetarian it was important that we find a good Indian restaurant that would fit the bill...
review_full: Having traveled for over two weeks in France and Spain by the time we reached Madrid we were ready for a good Indian meal. My wife being a strict vegetarian it was important that we find a good Indian restaurant that would fit the bill and satisfy her craving for some good Indian food. We found Restaurant Sagar on Google Maps. With some help from our hotel's concierge and a couple of phone calls to the restaurant an hour or so later at 12.30 pm on Aug 20 our taxi brought us to the doors of Sagar. Getting out we saw a lady at the door welcoming us in the traditional Indian way with a Namaste. Enter and you find this cozy ambiance. Very colorful but without the carved furniture that you see in many other Indian restaurants. The lady who was the owner introduced herself as Jaya and seated us at our tableThe waiter brought us menus and in the next over an hour we had the most satisfying Indian vegetarian lunch with garlic nan, aloo parathas, raita, malai kofta (unlike we have had anywhere before) complete with papads, gulab jamus, gajar halwa. All the food items were delicious and the conversation with the owner was interesting. As we sat and ate, the place started to fill up and we witnessed their service in action with all diners enjoying their experience there. At the end of the meal I was offered excellent liqueur that was chilled with chilled shot glasses to drink it from. We did not get a chance to return as we were busy with our explorations of Madrid and towns around the next four days. But if we return to Madrid, Sagar Restaurant will be definitely the place we will have some meals. EXCELLENT and with best wishes to Jayaji.

But they were really friendly and helpful after they finally got around to serving me.

title_review: Great food, warm reception, great place!
review_preview: I visited Sagar Resturant on 28th September, 2014 with 7 other colleagues (all Indian). It was hard to believe that we were really in Madrid at all. The interiors very colorful and very beautiful. Good Job!The food was delicious. They ask your preference of...
review_full: I visited Sagar Resturant on 28th September, 2014 with 7 other colleagues (all Indian). It was hard to believe that we were really in Madrid at all. The interiors very colorful and very beautiful. Good Job! The food was delicious. They ask your preference of "spicy-ness". The papad (pan cakes as they called it) were great and so were the appetizers. The chutneys were good (especially m,int). The portions are good for 2 people sharing. The reception was very nice. The lady that seemed in-charge of running the business was very kind, was almost always there to help us. I remember that there was some confusion in receiving my order. But she handled that pretty well and insisted that we "enjoyed our evening and didn't worry about anything else" which summarizes my experience. In my book, Sagar is an Ace <of hearts> keep it up guys. Highly recommended.

There weren't enough tables so we sat at the bar. I counted about 7 waiters, but they all seemed too busy cleaning glasses to serve us. 2 beers cost 12 euros and came with a very small bowl of mixed nuts. For this price you would expect everything to be top notch. There are 2 lifts going up to the rooftop terrace, but one was broken so it took ages waiting for the other one to arrive and only 4 people fit inside at a time. In the ladies toilets there are 2 sinks. One was broken - no water came out of the tap. There are about 4-5 toilets. 2 had no toilet paper and the lock was broken on another. We stayed for one drink, took in the view and then went to the terrace of the bar next door which was cheaper and the waiters were friendlier.

title_review: My favorite in Madrid but AVOID the food!
review_preview: I have been coming to the swimming pool/terraza at Room Mate Oscar for over a year now and absolutely love it! Whilst some may think that it is pricey (20 euros for three hours) I think is a good value and a beautiful escape from...
review_full: I have been coming to the swimming pool/terraza at Room Mate Oscar for over a year now and absolutely love it! Whilst some may think that it is pricey (20 euros for three hours) I think is a good value and a beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle of the centre of Madrid.  For 20 euros, you can choose a day time slot to spend by the pool and use its facilities (12-3pm or 3.30-6.30pm), the price includes a complimentary glass of cava OR a bottle of water, towels, comfortable sun beds, use of the pool and changing rooms/showers etc and a locker! The terraza boasts views of the beautiful city whilst being a calming and relaxing place to unwind! Bar drinks are surprisingly not expensive and the waiters (who speak Spanish and very good English) are very friendly.  One thing I would say is, AVOID the food! I ordered a Cesar salad and this was NOT what it was! I received salad leaves, lumps of cheddar and orange cheese, two small pieces of chicken (bite size) and a not so nice Cesar dressing. 10 euros down the drain!  I would recommend going as it is one of the very few outdoor swimming pools however eat before of after you go!

title_review: Our worst experience with an Indian Restaurant in all of Europe
review_preview: Went to this restaurant based on reviews on tripadvisor. Was the top rated indian restaurant here. Reached at around 9:30 pm and the first impression was that there must be something special about this place. It was the first indian restaurant which was completely packed....
review_full: Went to this restaurant based on reviews on tripadvisor. Was the top rated indian restaurant here. Reached at around 9:30 pm and the first impression was that there must be something special about this place. It was the first indian restaurant which was completely packed. We generally eat at around 8 pm and we were late due to a regional train delay. It could probably be because of the timing. We were asked to wait for 15 minutes. There were people who came after us but were given seats as they had prior reservations. It made sense and felt genuine. We waited for almost an hour (had not eaten indian food in a long time and hence the desperation) and then decided to order takeaway. There were two more couples who came after us but were given seats. Cant really say that they had reservations but it felt like we were being ignored. It was probably because the owner realized we were tourists who dont drink compared to locals who would be more valuable customers. We dont drink and tend to eat vegetarian main courses only. There were tables which were empty and one more group of 3 locals were immediately given a seat. That was the tipping point. Took the takeaway and the lady waived off charges for the dessert we had while waiting for over 1.5 hours. It was too little too late and i must say that we have never really felt insulted like this. It may have been the right decision from a commercial standpoint but left us really frustrated. Had vegetarian curry and nan. The food was average and could be rated at 3/5. Minus 2 for the bad experience. My advice - Try and make a reservations - If its packed and you are a tourist without a reservation, then you need to cross your fingers - Would anyday prefer to eat indian food at a restaurant that dosent require waiting compared to one that requires such a long wait even if the quality is much better

title_review: Superb! One of the best curry houses in Spain
review_preview: As brit expats in Madrid we are always on the look out for a decent Indian restaurant locally and we've tried quite a few - most of which are dark, badly decorated places that serve mediocre food with little flavour or charm. We've even tried...
review_full: As brit expats in Madrid we are always on the look out for a decent Indian restaurant locally and we've tried quite a few - most of which are dark, badly decorated places that serve mediocre food with little flavour or charm. We've even tried this restaurant a few years ago in its previous form before it was given a makeover by the Spanish TV's version of 'Kitchen Nightmares' and it was passable at the time but we never went back. But now - what a surpirise! What a fantastic improvement! Cosy interior with bright, vibrant colours; great atmosphere; superb service; and above all the food was delicious. Some of the best curries we've ever had in Spain without a shadow of a doubt. The owner was extremely attentive and helpful, making some recommendations from the menu that were spot on - nothing too spicy for the kids, something with good bite for us, etc. The rest of the staff were very professional and pleasant too. Don't be put off by its location - make the effort to go there if you want an incredible curry in a super setting - you won't be disappointed at all. Real life proof that these makeover shows on TV can and do make a big difference. We will definitely return as often as we can.

review_preview: It's just on the street behind our house, so it's kind of neighbourhood exotic restaurant that we go for meeting friends who also like exotic food.The owner is very nice, she is always smiling and asking you if everything is ok. The food portion...
review_full: It's just on the street behind our house, so it's kind of neighbourhood exotic restaurant that we go for meeting friends who also like exotic food. The owner is very nice, she is always smiling and asking you if everything is ok.  The food portion is not big, but when it is inside your stomach, you feel stuffed immediately. Indu food for me is like once every 3 months, if I don't eat curry, I definitely miss it within 3 months. However, if I eat it every week, I would get bored.  The service is quick and there is a couple of times, the waiters seemed to be in a hurry to close the place even when we were having our desserts and finishing the drinks. This is rude as they have a timetable pointing out the opening hours, and we respected it, but they didn't repect us.  In any case, the food is excellent. After trying almost everything from the carte, I personally recommend curry chicken (it's not that I'm boring or a classic, it's because they really do good curry chicken.) Creamy sauce, authentic curry taste and tender chicken. Vegies and cheese balls is also a must. Then if you are starving, you can also ask for a deep fried starter. For drinking I like the salty lassie. Don't forget to ask cheese or garlic Nan/ rice for the wonderful curry sauce, I promise there will be none left in your plate. Mango jelly and ice cream is funny, they made the jelly like small ice cube shape and put them as topping of the ice cream. It's my favourite Indu in Madrid after Curry in Calle Silva and Ganges in Calle Potosi.

title_review: Wonderful service, especially good for gluten-free options
review_preview: This is my favourite Indian restaurant in town. I've lost count of the number of times I've had take-aways from there or gone for a sit-down meal. The owners are delightful, the service is supurb and the quality of the food is excellent. I particularly...
review_full: This is my favourite Indian restaurant in town. I've lost count of the number of times I've had take-aways from there or gone for a sit-down meal. The owners are delightful, the service is supurb and the quality of the food is excellent. I particularly recommend Sagar for diners with special requirements, such as gluten or lactose intolerance. As the food is made on the spot and sourced by them, they can adapt to all dietry requirements.  Sagar es el mejor restaurante indio en Madrid, sin excepción. No puedo contar el número de veces que he ido, tanto para cenar como para recoger un "take-away". La calidad, el sabor y la variedad es siempre exquisito. Además, tienen la facilidad de preparar comidas para dietas especiales, véase celiaco o bajo en sal. Recomiendo que paséis a probar su menú de degustación. Os sorprenderá gratamente.

review_preview: We ate at Casa Toni at 9:30 on a Tuesday night: me, my husband, two young daughters, and my in-laws. When my mothet-in-law first sat down, she saw nothing appealing on the menu at first. She is a picky eater and would prefer to eat...
review_full: We ate at Casa Toni at 9:30 on a Tuesday night: me, my husband, two young daughters, and my in-laws. When my mothet-in-law first sat down, she saw nothing appealing on the menu at first. She is a picky eater and would prefer to eat Italian each night. We sat upstairs (the waitress turned on the a/c for us thankfully) and ordered beers, mushrooms, eggplant, calamari (barely breaded, nicely seasoned), steamed mussels, mixed salad (fresh lettuce, good tomatoes and onions in a light vinaigrette), pork skewer, and gazpacho (pureed and very tasty). All was really very fresh-tasting and good. We cleared the table, plus 2 baskets of bread and 2 servings of olives. Our waitress spoke good English but was friendly and made a kind attempt to understand our poor Spanish, which we didn't find in every Madrid restaurant. On our way out, our waitress gave us a free drink of muscato, which was a delicious dessert.

review_preview: As vegetarians we were quite thrilled to see this restaurant right across our short stay apartment in Madrid. The reviews excited us even more and expectations went even higher when we went on Thu evening and found it to be full house. We booked a...
review_full: As vegetarians we were quite thrilled to see this restaurant right across our short stay apartment in Madrid. The reviews excited us even more and expectations went even higher when we went on Thu evening and found it to be full house. We booked a reservation for Fri and were unfortunately left disappointed both with the food and service. Lets start with the food - I get that its not so easy to make creative dishes for vegans but at least the dishes should look appetizing. Most things we ordered looked dull and insipid. As for taste - Starters of pate's with bread was reasonably good. The main courses - risotto was tasty, the tacos decent, the zucchini lasagna passable and the enchiladas inedible (bitter). The highlight of our meal was the blueberry cheesecake which was light and perfect. Now service - there was only 1 waitress for a full restaurant and we felt quite sorry for her as she looked harrowed and kept forgetting orders. I don't blame her at all, they need to improve staffing levels. For a meal of 4, we paid close to 70 Euros including a glass of wine & 2 beers. so pricing is not so high, but food was lackadaisal!

review_full: This restaurant is located very much in a well known area of Madrid and is very conveniently located near the Avenue De America metro station. The service staff is not that great and could do with a few lessons on basic manners as well as customer service. The desserts are not that great and not at all recommended but the appetizer offerings are extensive than what I had expected.  A couple of visits have made it clear that most of the business is due to the takeaways due to the number of delivery websites the place has tied up with. All in all if you are in Madrid only for a few nights ( unlike me who is here for grad school ) then you could try this place.

review_preview: We have been visiting Casa Toni since the current owners moved from working in a nearby well-known Madrid tapas chain to open their own establishment over 20 years ago.  Quite simply, we love the place!   We love the food, the wine, the atmosphere and the...
review_full: We have been visiting Casa Toni since the current owners moved from working in a nearby well-known Madrid tapas chain to open their own establishment over 20 years ago. Quite simply, we love the place! We love the food, the wine, the atmosphere and the staff. It doesn't matter how many months between our visits to Madrid, we are always welcomed cordially, the food is excellent and freshly cooked to order and the wine goes down a treat. There is always an interesting mixture of regulars in and out of Casa Toni as well as tourists following some book or You tube recommendation and even groups of people doing a Madrid tapas tours. We often get chatting to other customers from different countries and spend delightful evenings with good food, good wine, good company and good service in vibrant surroundings. My particular favourite dish is the Mollejas but my husband is vegetarian so I always order a half portion. His favourite dish is the Berenejas - griddled aubergine (i.e. egg plant) drizzled with honey and I certainly share that with him. We always order patatas alioi and patatas bravas too. Delicious, utterly scrumptious! It's mouth watering just thinking about it. Can't wait to go back to Casa Toni again.

title_review: There's a reason the place is packed with Spanish people.
review_preview: One of the best, warmest welcoming places in Madrid if you'd ask me. They have a great menu but one thing stands out. The thing all of the tourists try: the crispy pig ears. Try them. They may not be your thing, but you'll be...
review_full: One of the best, warmest welcoming places in Madrid if you'd ask me. They have a great menu but one thing stands out. The thing all of the tourists try: the crispy pig ears. Try them. They may not be your thing, but you'll be glad you tried. It's something unique to Casa Toni, and they're served hot from the grill with a piquillo pepper sauce.  The flavour is a bit like bacon, but more fatty, and chewier. It's pretty great when you get used to it. Oh, and they're dirt cheap. Tip the guys a little extra!

For mains we both had a vegetable pad thai with tempeh which we also really enjoyed. By dessert, we were almost too full but because the food was so good, we shared a raw cacao brownie. You honestly wouldn't know the food was vegan so if you're dining with people who are weary of vegan food, just don't tell them. The staff were also very friendly and attentive.

I am sure this is great for non-vegans too as you do not miss out on taste, on the contrary!

review_full: This restaurant offers a variety of Indian dishes and some are better than others. We ordered the butter chicken, which was very good and a larger portion than expected. We asked for spicy, but it was still probably medium. We also ordered the malai chicken tikka, which on the other hand wasn’t very good at all. It arrived cold on a sizzling dish and wasn’t very visually appetizing. The chicken chunks were too big and appeared as if the yogurt and seasoning were applied after the chicken was cooked. To note, it is all white meat chicken. We have high standards for Indian restaurants since we are of that background. The manager definitely was hospitable and offered us complementary dessert. They strictly follow the reservation policy, so make sure to make one. The decor is just average and it was a little out of the way for us.  We left satisfied, but weren’t by any means blown away. Overall 3 stars based on quality of the food alone.

The service was extremely friendly and reasonably fast. Definitely fairly priced. They also had a great selection of beers. Don't be afraid to step off the beaten path and get away from the touristy parts, you won't regret it! Pictured: Tacos

review_preview: We went on a reasonably quiet Sunday evening and had a great three course dinner.We booked but went early (around 8) and there were plenty of free tables.We shared the mixed appetiser which was tasty and interesting, then I loved the cabbage cannelloni-really...
review_full: We went on a reasonably quiet Sunday evening and had a great three course dinner. We booked but went early (around 8) and there were plenty of free tables. We shared the mixed appetiser which was tasty and interesting, then I loved the cabbage cannelloni-really interesting! Likewise my partner enjoyed the chickpeas. For dessert he had the almond cake which was great, and I had the rice pudding, this wasn’t quite what I expected (smooth not grainy!) but ok all the same! Service was really friendly and the beautiful ceramics everything is served on added to the meal! Good value too at less than €50 for three courses and a drink for two and service. Highly recommend, plenty of good stuff on the menu to get us to return too.

I would recommend booking in advance and just be aware that the starters are on the large side, so unless you really have an appetite you may want to share one!

review_preview: I arrived at the restaurant at 10:45 pm and my friends had already had early dinner. The restaurant was full so I expected I would have to wait. However there was a large table available and I was offered that table just so I wouldn't...
review_full: I arrived at the restaurant at 10:45 pm and my friends had already had early dinner. The restaurant was full so I expected I would have to wait. However there was a large table available and I was offered that table just so I wouldn't have to wait longer for food and since they didn't have any reservations in place. Being an Indian in a new country where Indians aren't as common as in England, they made me feel at home. The food arrived within 10-15 minutes and was really hot. I had ordered a curry with Tandoori Roti with Biryani for take away. The curry was really tasty and spicy as written in the description, something I failed to find over my time in Madrid. The food was really nice and I ordered a kulfi afterwards which was great too. Time and again, I was asked whether I need anything or if the food was according to my tasted. I was really made to feel at home. Even more hospitable than the restaurants back in India. Definitely very happy. A taste of India in both food and hospitality. A must go for people wishing to have a taste of Indian food.

review_preview: My friend and I arrived here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We didn't have a reservation, but the restaurant was almost empty and they were able to seat us. We ordered some wine which was served with a small sweet potato mash tapa -...
review_full: My friend and I arrived here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We didn't have a reservation, but the restaurant was almost empty and they were able to seat us.  We ordered some wine which was served with a small sweet potato mash tapa - it was delicious. We ordered some croquettes to start. There were six (two different types), spinach and blue cheese and potato and black garlic, served with a mustard sauce. I preferred the potato and black garlic ones. The blue cheese ones tasted a little funny to me, probably because I generally don't like vegan cheeses. We really liked the mustard sauce.  My friend ordered the burger and I had the tacos. I enjoyed the tacos immensely and the quantity was satisfying, but I still wished for a little bit more. The burger was okay. Definitely a bigger portion than the tacos, but maybe not as tasty. We ordered a berry cheesecake for dessert to share. I liked the berry sauce but not the cheesecake. It tasted a little too artificial for me, however, my friend really liked it.  Overall, we had a pleasant experience at La Encomienda. The food was good, service was excellent, and I personally enjoy supporting vegan establishments. I have yet to return here. Mostly because I do not live or work in the area.  I can recommend this place to vegans - especially raw vegans because there are lots of raw options. But, unfortunately, I don't think a non-vegan would particularly enjoy the food here.

title_review: Great neighborhood bar with awesome food
review_preview: We dropped by Casa Toni per the recommendation of The Spain Guy on YouTube. We were not disappointed! These little pubs are the best way to eat and drink in Spain. They are cheap and serve good quality (and made to order!) dishes and drinks....
review_full: We dropped by Casa Toni per the recommendation of The Spain Guy on YouTube. We were not disappointed! These little pubs are the best way to eat and drink in Spain. They are cheap and serve good quality (and made to order!) dishes and drinks. We ordered the blood sausage (which we had never tried but we really liked it) and pork skewers, beers and vermouth. Everything was delicious and super cheap (like 14 Euros total?). The staff was fun and engaging. When we asked who Toni is, the server replied "We are all Toni!".

review_preview: The last time I visited Casa Toni was in 2015. In fact I visited it twice on that trip to Spain, a nice bookend of tapas on my visit to Madrid both coming to and departing that fabulous city.  On my last night in Madrid...
review_full: The last time I visited Casa Toni was in 2015. In fact I visited it twice on that trip to Spain, a nice bookend of tapas on my visit to Madrid both coming to and departing that fabulous city. On my last night in Madrid this time out, I think I was saving up for what I hoped but knew would be a memorable feast. Tapas, they can't be beat. Simple and yet perfect. A bowl of Green Spanish olives, a basket of bread and some remarkably effervescent mineral water preceeded the perfect eggplant with sugar syrup, fried green peppers, a fresh tomato salad followed by a plate of calamari. All of this aided by 6 glasses of rioja, shared with my wife and two complementary aperatifs all for under 50 Euros. They rule, they rock. You've got to go! I've got to go back.

title_review: Excellent food if you are open minded
review_preview: So we were walking to Inclan Brutal Bar for dinner when we passed by this place with a window showing all the goodies they have.  Obvious the unusual organs got us interested and we decided to stop by for a little bite (literally we didn't...
review_full: So we were walking to Inclan Brutal Bar for dinner when we passed by this place with a window showing all the goodies they have. Obvious the unusual organs got us interested and we decided to stop by for a little bite (literally we didn't plan to eat more than 1/4 of a plate to save our stomachs for the "real dinner"). We were there early so it was not packed yet. Service was very friendly even though we couldn't speak spanish. The sangria was excellent. Despite our request to give us smaller portions for the same price, the portions were good. The fried anchovies were good. But the pigs ear was to die for. I've never had such good plate of pigs ear and don't think my chances are good finding another as good as this in the future. I took a chance and tried the kidneys and it was excellent too, no odor. Should have just decided to sit down and get the dinner done there, since we finished the whole plate of pig's ear and half of the other two. Obviously our dinner paled in comparison to this.   In our one and half week trip this was the best tapas I've had in Spain. I would go back there in a heart beat.

We came here for lunch, pining for classic Spanish tapas and that's exactly what we got. We ordered calamares, gambas al ajillo, patatas bravioli (spicy red sauce and aioli), pimientos de padrón, morcilla, chorizo, croquetas, lacón a la plancha and sangría all of which I would definitely recommend. It was delicious and reasonably priced. The service was exceptional. I will definitely be returning on my next visit.

review_full: My wife and I had just arrived Madrid and it was time to eat. Our hotel was a few blocks from this nice just out of the way area from the main street. We also saw that it was rec'd in Rick Steves guide. It's hit and miss with the guides as far as I'm concerned. This was one of those times that the reviews were pretty good. The area abounds in small restaurants. It's crowded with lots of people. It feels good. Lots to choose from if you don't get into Casa Toni or if you don't feel like waiting on a busy night. The food was good for the most part. The shrimp in garlic was OK but that's it. The gazpacho was good and the mushrooms also. This was our first stop to eat in Spain and we learned quite a bit along the way. The atmosphere is noisy and crowded on both floors. It's all part of the experience.  I think that you will enjoy this spot.

title_review: THE BEST VARITY OF AUTHENTIC TAPAS IN  MADRID, IN ONE PLACE!  RUSTIC, CASUAL, MOM AND POP
review_preview: We went to this Mom and Pop twice on a 3 Day trip to Mardid.  We tried 16 other tapas Bars around Madrid and this one made us come back for more!     As others stated the food is fresh cooked to order all home made...
review_full: We went to this Mom and Pop twice on a 3 Day trip to Mardid. We tried 16 other tapas Bars around Madrid and this one made us come back for more! As others stated the food is fresh cooked to order all home made recipies. Staff does not speak English but are very friendly and can figure out menue with little help.  We had Garlic Shrimp , Sweetbread(lamb neck glands), Serrano peppers(not spicy sort of like a very mild green pepper that is grilled with coarse salt), Cooked to order mushrooms in sauce, anchovies marinated and anchovies whole deep fried.   The primary reason we went back 2nd time was for the Lamb neck glands(does not look like much) but is HEAVEN ON A PLATE. The Garlic shrimp were exquisite piping hot with amazing flavor best we had in Madrid. Mushrooms were great flavor and we liked the Serrano peppers here the best. They provide free bread to soak up the juices left over on our plates. You get free tapas (green olives) when you order a beer or vermouth. They also give you a shot glass of wine for free with your check, that is a great touch. They know how to take care of their customers and bring them back.  Place can get busy if you go at Spanish diner hour at 8-9 pm might be standing room only. We were there at 7PM (when they re-open for dinner) place was empty and was HEAVING when we left at 8. Casa Toni was the highlight of our Tapas experience in Madrid. Very reasonably priced nothing over 8 Euros. There is no place else where you can go on a culinary adventure in one small venue. The food is FANTASTIC!  Absolutely, should be put on your tapas crawl through Madrid. Does not get any more reasonable friendly and crazy good than Casa Toni. This should be #1 place on TA for Madrid Yes, you can find unique huge dinners with suckling lamb or pig for 100 euro a pop around Madrid (But that made us feel guilty) or you can Tapas crawl to at least 5 places for same price in this neighborhood... enjoy culture and people as you stroll the ever so safe district. My favorite area of Madrid for tapas. When I go back to Madrid this will be the tapas bar I woud be thinking of when I got off the plane or train! Enjoy!!

review_preview: As a foodie it was great to sit at the bar and watch the chef in a tiny kitchen feet away at a hot-plate turning unheard-of offal in to ambrosia (maybe rose-coloured, alcohol fueled hidsight making it food of the gods?). Zarajos are an example:-...
review_full: As a foodie it was great to sit at the bar and watch the chef in a tiny kitchen feet away at a hot-plate turning unheard-of offal in to ambrosia (maybe rose-coloured, alcohol fueled hidsight making it food of the gods?).  Zarajos are an example:- sheep intestines (chitterlings if you are squeemish enough to need euphemisms) turned in to something resembling a rubber ball then deep fried. Sound disgusting? Right! But it is actually quite nice with beer and probably even better with Vermouth (a fairly normal Madrid drink). I didn't see them in any other bars for some reason. Other offal available there include sweet-breads ("lambs neck glands" on the menu) morcia (blood pudding) and kidneys - all done in front of you on the hot plate with subtle slight-of-hand with seasoning. Does this not appeal to you? Come ON - you're on holiday! Try something new. Live! Visit Toni's

review_preview: So, I have actually taken a minute to think about this bar! Because I would like to give  a full and detailed description of my experience. The first time I went to Oscar I was quite delighted by my experience, it was a hot day...
review_full: So, I have actually taken a minute to think about this bar! Because I would like to give a full and detailed description of my experience.  The first time I went to Oscar I was quite delighted by my experience, it was a hot day and my boyfriend and I had always wanted to go. As soon as we got to the hotel we were greeted by the reception staff, we were asked by the lobby concierge as to where we were going. He was absolutely adorable and full of smiles, I forgot to take his name but you would spot him immediately with his huge smile and talkative personality. Once we actually got to the bar it was quite refreshing, to find a place that could've potentially been very "snooty and pretentious" if need be. But Oscar is not like that, it's quite multilayered.Upon entering we went straight to the bar, this will probably be the only real" negative" I will have about this place. But once at the bar, no one really greeted or acknowledged us, now maybe this bothered me more due to having worked in the service industry before, where customer acknowledgement was very important. There were about six or seven bar staff behind the bar and even though it was busy a simple hello, would of sufficed. I found one staff member, dressed like the rest with his little earpiece to be more aware of his looks than the customers. Eventually when someone paid us some attention it was all smooth sailing after that. We met a lovely waiter called Antonio, he's been mentioned quite abit and that is probably due to his naturally kind and approachable waitering style which seems genuine. Since then, I have been back quite often, taking friends and colleagues and my opinion about him has been reinforced. He is one of the waiters who was quite helpful and very attentive. I feel the rest smile when they serve you but once gone, eye contact is hard to find. At the end of the day it's a bar! A rather pricey one, not the most expensive but definitely pricey, It's not a modeling show! So all those really tense, Zoolander don't talk to me, I'm busy making a cocktail type waiters need a chill pill!!  Other than that it's a really lovely place, It is the type of place where you would find all walks of life. I love that you can find mature, young, thin, white, brown all types, so it makes it pleasurable. The cocktails are delicious and really well made, I love the fact that you can ask the waiters to make it "stronger" if you happen to be a "social drinker" like myself:) they happily oblige.  I do think management should think about repriceing their table charge or bottle charge, €150 for a bottle is borderline greed, I know, salaries,rent and whatnot but that's merely my opinion on that!  I would recommend this bar to any and everyone! It's fabulous and the music is great! what a really Ibiza like stomping grounds to have in good old Chuecs!! And look out for Antonio he'll really complete your experience.

title_review: Old school friendly place with good food
review_preview: This is a place that reminded my Spanish born lady of the food that she enjoyed over 40 years ago before moving to Australia. We visited for an early lunch and the decor was reassuringly fitting for a place with a strong local clientele of...
review_full: This is a place that reminded my Spanish born lady of the food that she enjoyed over 40 years ago before moving to Australia. We visited for an early lunch and the decor was reassuringly fitting for a place with a strong local clientele of working people. The waitress helpfully explained in Spanish both the serving sizes and what items had already been sold out. We enjoyed the large servings of squid, octopus and tripe stew. We washed this down with beer on tap. Everything was value for money compared to most other establishments in the area that appear to have been tricked up to attract the tourist trade. An English menu was provided.

review_preview: Being experienced travellers and diners from Oz, we've developed a nose for finding good places to eat. We avoid tourist areas and seek out the local's haunts. We've had mixed success from following various guides and reviews but gut feel seems to work best for...
review_full: Being experienced travellers and diners from Oz, we've developed a nose for finding good places to eat. We avoid tourist areas and seek out the local's haunts. We've had mixed success from following various guides and reviews but gut feel seems to work best for us. And so it was when we stumbled across Casa Toni around 9:00pm, having already had great garlic prawns for starters at another little joint just up the street. The displays of various foods on offer in the front window 1st attracted us. Various types of mushrooms, seafood, meats and offal, which a bit keen on I must say. We looked inside and saw a modest crowd of only locals, with room for us at the bar. We were welcomed with pleasant greetings not usually offered tourists and sat down to enjoy some of the best Tapas we've experienced. Great staff and service, very reasonably priced and generous dishes freshly cooked at the bar by an entertaining and friendly (can you believe it?) chef. Couldn't fault it other than no desserts or coffees available, so we moved on for that. Highly recommended and a must visit!!!!

title_review: Arguably the best food in Madrid
review_preview: My husband and I were so lucky to experience this amazing rustic and authentic Tapas restaurant with a Local who knew about it and is a regular. Their food is absolutely incredible. They cook everything fresh on one hot grill and it is to die...
review_full: My husband and I were so lucky to experience this amazing rustic and authentic Tapas restaurant with a Local who knew about it and is a regular. Their food is absolutely incredible. They cook everything fresh on one hot grill and it is to die for. We were very adventurous and tried their sweet breads (trust me- ORDER IT!!) The flavor is so full, so incredibly tasty and we had to keep going back for more. We also tried their kidney, the fried cuttlefish, their calamari, boccarones, blood sausage, and oh my goodness... THE MUSHROOMS! Disclaimer- my husband and I usually are pescatarians back in the states but we decided that for this trip we would go all out and eat everything and we are so glad that we did! Their food was like taking the heart of Spain and by keeping it simple, fresh and authentic- they completely won us over. If you want to experience Spain like a local- then you have to visit Casa Toni. They’re friendly, welcoming and with its popularity, there’s always a good buzz and vibe anywhere you sit in the restaurant.

title_review: Wanted to access the rooftop pool without any luck
review_preview: I am not staying at this hotel but according to the internet you can pay for access to the rooftop pool, half or whole day. Half day cost 25 euro. I was aiming at a refreshing half day at the pool. But on arrival the...
review_full: I am not staying at this hotel but according to the internet you can pay for access to the rooftop pool, half or whole day. Half day cost 25 euro. I think it is horrific that when they close the pool for over three days they do not publish this on the internet. The reception tried to help me with finding another pool. But one suggestion (Indigo), did not allow others than the hotel recidents access to the pool. The other suggestion (emperador) charged 35 euro for a whole day and by the time I was there I only had 2 hours left before other appointments. Also the Emperador does not have parasols so it could possibly be a very hot experience in the sunbed. So all this effort I turned out to end up in a Tapas bar. Very disappointing experince.
