review_preview: My family and I came here to celebrate my mom's 65th birthday while we were traveling in Spain. I have to say being from San Francisco and having culinary geniuses around every corner I thought it would be a good meal but didn't have any...
review_full: My family and I came here to celebrate my mom's 65th birthday while we were traveling in Spain. I have to say being from San Francisco and having culinary geniuses around every corner I thought it would be a good meal but didn't have any crazy expectations. The staff here blew us away. They sat us in a semi private room toward the back of the restaurant. In the room was a large round table and a book shelf with the restaurant's Michelin awards.  The staff didn't speak the best english so some of the nuance was lost but they were incredibly friendly and attentive. We decided to do the rendevous menu for five. The first course although not very good was super innovative and fun.  Overall, this was one of the best meals of my life. The only other 2 star resturant I had been to til now was Manresa in Los Gatos and club allard made that experience feel mediocre. The total tab for 5 (with wine pairings for 2) was ~520euro. This seemed like a bargain considering the beautiful execution. They also threw in an extra pre-dessert which was special for mom's birthday. At the end of the meal, my indian mother who has never been to a meal like this couldn't stop talking about the little details. The most amusing part for her was they used the tiniest mushrooms in one of their courses. Its the little details that make a place great

review_preview: Visited to celebrate my husband's birthday. I chose it based on the reviews on trip advisor and wasn't disappointed. The whole experience was perfect. Right from when I got in touch to book the staff were a perfect mix of friendliness and professionalism. The food...
review_full: Visited to celebrate my husband's birthday. I chose it based on the reviews on trip advisor and wasn't disappointed. The whole experience was perfect. Right from when I got in touch to book the staff were a perfect mix of friendliness and professionalism. The food was out of this world but it is not just the taste - this is performance food at its best. We went 'all in' and chose the 14 course Revolution and every course was superb. The butter fish shot and the egg and truffle cupcake were a particular highlight. One tip though is don't eat too much of the delicious bread as the 14 courses really add up! With the help of the sommelier who was very friendly we chose a white wine with the starter courses and a red for the main. Both perfectly complimented the food.  I don't understand some of the comments on trip advisor about the staff not bing friendly or speaking good English. Neither was the case. The staff were all both friendly and very knowledgable and their English was good enough to describe all the dishes perfectly well - much much better than my Spanish! I would thoroughly recommend El Club Allard for a really special food experience. It wasn't cheap but definitely worth it for a special occasion.

review_full: Visited with my mum. We had no reservation so did some waiting, but it was a pleasant wait (The mojitos are amazing!). The menu is short and deceptively simple. We both opted for Salads which were excellent and more than enough after a hot day. Clientele are an interesting mix of locals and tourists. The atmosphere is friendly and quite cosy. The staff are attentive and good humoured. They sent us on our merry way with shots (my mum's first in about 10 years) and smiles at the end of the evening. Definitely worth a visit. I'll be back!

review_preview: We had the seduction menu with a wine pairing. As others have mentioned the meal starts with you eating the business card with a mayo like dip. It was somewhat tasteless but innovative. Next came three snacks of which our favourite was the egg and...
review_full: We had the seduction menu with a wine pairing. As others have mentioned the meal starts with you eating the business card with a mayo like dip. It was somewhat tasteless but innovative.  Next came three snacks of which our favourite was the egg and truffle cupcake topped with a spinach foam. The waiters then served us the entrees- the sea rice, onion soup and hibiscus flower (eponymous dish). The sea rice was really awesome and innovative (we wont ruin the surprise). After came the two mains- we had the turbot and the suckling pig. Both were excellent! The mains were the highlight of the meal. Dessert was quite lacklustre in comparison. The almond cake might seem like a boring dessert but was lifted by inventive touches.  Wine pairing for the seduction menu includes four wines with refills , mostly spanish ones. Highly recommended as it was good value at only 30 euros.  Service was a bit of a letdown. The waiters were quite cold and did not seem very interested in the food. The assistant sommelier poured the wrong wine into our cup (a white into an existing red) though she did apologize and poured a fresh glass. We ordered ceylon tea but the waiter gave us a chinese tea instead- perhaps due to a language barrier. However they did try to take our dietary preferences into consideration. I mentioned that i disliked mint and they eliminated that from one of the dessert dishes. If you are planning to do this however, note that they seem to only eliminate the item and not replace it with something else.  All in all we paid 250 euros for 2 pax and it was great value for money

Drinks were good and prices were reasonable,platters were plentiful. There is upstairs seating. SO why didn't I give it 5 stars? When other tables sat down they were given a bowl of olives, mini sandwiches etc. Everyone! ANd we were taken care of by the owner and a few others. We were a family with a 19 and 13 year old. We are quiet and respectful. I don't like watching other people getting things we don't. It does not seem fair. We bought several drinks and 7 plates most others had 1-3. They should be fairer

review_preview: We had a brilliant meal at Casa Toni, the best one in Madrid so far and we have eaten well on this trip. An unassuming little place, full of locals in the know. Service is extremely friendly and attentive, and the food is authentic, delicious,...
review_full: We had a brilliant meal at Casa Toni, the best one in Madrid so far and we have eaten well on this trip.  An unassuming little place, full of locals in the know. Service is extremely friendly and attentive, and the food is authentic, delicious, uncomplicated, and fresh with everything being prepared to order.  We had panfried sweetbreads, which were expertly seasoned and melt-in-the-mouth, the blackened and fried mild green chilis topped with flakes of sea salt were an absolute highlight, the spicing of the blood sausage was spot on; and the anchovies marinated in vinegar, the olives marinated in olive oil and oregano, and the potatoes with aioli were also delicious. And the portions are generous, too! Great experience overall.

review_preview: Fantastic little tapas bar!  Absolutely delicious raciones & tapas, warm lively atmosphere, friendly quick service, and excellent value.  This is the kind of local spot I love when we travel - homey and authentic.  We stopped in for an early dinner 7:30-ish because another TA...
review_full: Fantastic little tapas bar! Absolutely delicious raciones & tapas, warm lively atmosphere, friendly quick service, and excellent value. This is the kind of local spot I love when we travel - homey and authentic. We stopped in for an early dinner 7:30-ish because another TA review had mentioned that Casa Toni serves fried baby squid (chopitos aka chiparones), which I had enjoyed all over Barcelona but have been unable to find in Madrid. We ended up ordering a couple of drinks, fried squid, fried anchovies, shrimp in garlic (gambas al ajillo), and eggplant, and all were excellent. The fried items were in a very light batter and perfectly crisp and non-greasy. We noticed that diners at the next tables had ordered yummy-looking fried peppers (pimientos al patron) and potatoes brava, which they said were delicious. Portions are generous, and the waiter wrapped up my leftovers for breakfast :) The sole drawback is that the place has only 5 tables and a bar - when we left at 8:30, it was crowded. We've eaten at about 20 different restaurants in Madrid in our past 2 visits, and I plan to return to Casa Toni tomorrow.
